questions.title: Part 2: Learning new functions within an application
questions.text: You have just completed a questionnaire about learning to do the same tasks better. The second questonnaire is about learning new functionality.

After a user has become competent enough at using an application to no longer be considered a novice, how do they continue to learn about all of the various functionality/capabilities the application has?


For example, many people use Microsoft Word to complete their work, but not all users are aware of functions Microsoft Word provides such as a bibliography manager, the ability to create charts, or the ability to find and replace all instances of a term.


We are interested in studying how people continue to learn about the functionality of applications, after they have already achieved competence.

questions.instructions: On a scale of 1 to 5, how interested are you in learning new functionality when you use computer applications repeatedly?
When you consider applications that you frequently use, how many times a month (on average) do you learn something new about the application?
How many times a month (on average) do you use the following methods to learn new functions within an application?

q_text.text: System suggestion other than tip of the day
Internet search (eg: can application do X?)
Performed it by mistake when trying to do something else
Read about it in an article

questions.instructions: Are there any other methods you use to learn about new functions, which are not listed above? (Optional)
Think of a time when you learned about a new functionality.  Please state the application, what method you used to learn this new information, and give a brief description of what you learned.
Do you have any other comments? (Optional)
